block.p: Kristine Donna Hooks, the daughter of Carol Hooks of Alexandria, Va., and John Hooks of Burke, Va., was married yesterday to Stephen Bruce Holden, a son of Susan and Stephen Holden III of Rye Brook, N.Y. Robert James Friedman, a retired judge of the City Court of White Plains, officiated at the Northgate at Dockside Harbor, a restaurant in Cold Spring, N.Y.

Mrs. Holden, 32, is an assistant corporation counsel in the New York City Law Department. She graduated from the University of Virginia and New York Law School. Her father is a civil engineer with the Transportation Department in Washington. Her mother is a computer systems manager for the Employee Relocation Counsel, a trade organization in Washington. The bride is a stepdaughter of Linda Hooks.

Kristine Donna Hooks, the daughter of Carol Hooks of Alexandria, Va., and John Hooks of Burke, Va., was married yesterday to Stephen Bruce Holden, a son of Susan and Stephen Holden III of Rye Brook, N.Y. Robert James Friedman, a retired judge of the City Court of White Plains, officiated at the Northgate at Dockside Harbor, a restaurant in Cold Spring, N.Y.

Mrs. Holden, 32, is an assistant corporation counsel in the New York City Law Department. She graduated from the University of Virginia and New York Law School. Her father is a civil engineer with the Transportation Department in Washington. Her mother is a computer systems manager for the Employee Relocation Counsel, a trade organization in Washington. The bride is a stepdaughter of Linda Hooks.

Later this month, Mr. Holden, 31, is to become a law clerk in New York for the enforcement division of the Securities and Exchange Commission. He graduated from Cornell University and received a law degree cum laude from St. John's University. His mother is a guidance counselor at Edgemont Junior-Senior High School in Scarsdale, N.Y. His father is a partner with Holden Brothers, a White Plains law firm.
